meanings.definition: To manufacture or construct in advance, especially in standardized sections for easy assembly.
meanings.sent1: The company prefabricates the walls of the house before bringing them to the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The furniture company prefabricates the shelves to save time during assembly.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly prefabricated a chair with three legs and one armrest.
meanings.sent4: Her mind prefabricates scenarios of success before any important presentation.
meanings.sent5: The chef prefabricates the pizza dough to ensure a consistent texture every time.

meanings.sent1: The artist prefabricates sketches of his paintings before starting the final piece.
meanings.sent2: The toy company prefabricates the parts of the model airplane for easy assembly.
meanings.sent3: The students prefabricated excuses for not completing their homework.
meanings.sent4: His dreams prefabricate images of a future filled with adventure and success.
meanings.sent5: The tailor prefabricates the patterns for the dresses to streamline the sewing process.
